entry.title: Publications
entry.summary: In press / recently published Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Petri Ylikoski (2021) Explaining Institutional Change, to appear in the Oxford Handbook…
entry.content:
In press / recently published

  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Petri Ylikoski (2021) Explaining Institutional Change, to appear in the Oxford Handbook of the Philosophy of Political Science, edited by Harold Kincaid, and Jeroen Van Bouwel. Oxford: Oxford University Press.
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Samuli Reijula; Petri Ylikoski (2020) Argumentative Landscapes: the functions of models in social epistemology, Synthese, https://doi.org/10.1007/s11229-020-02661-9 (🔓 Open Access)

Books

The Invisible Hand in Economics: How Economists Explain Unintended Social Consequences, INEM Advances in Economic Methodology, London: Routledge, 2008.

Economics Made Fun: Philosophy of the pop-economics, edited by N. Emrah Aydinonat & Jack Vromen, London: Routledge, 2015

İktisat Nedir?, İletişim Yayınları,  2014

in Turkish, What is Economics?

Hayatın İçindeki İktisat: İktisadi Davranışlara Farklı Bir Bakış (with Ü. Barış Urhan), İletişim Yayınları, 

in Turkish, Economics in (Everyday) Life: Another Look at Economic Behavior

Görünmez Adam Smith, (with Mine Kara) İletişim Yayınları,  2010

in Turkish, The Invisible Adam Smith

Modern Uluslararası İktisat Teorisinin Kökenleri: Karşılaştırmalı Üstünlükler, Neo-Klasik Fiyat Teorisi ve Heckscher-Ohlin Teoremi, Siyasal Yayınevi, Ankara, 2007,

in Turkish, Roots of Modern International Economics: Comparative Advantages, Neoclassic Price Theory and the Heckscher-Ohlin Theorem

 

Articles

  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Petri Ylikoski (2021) Explaining Institutional Change, to appear in the Oxford Handbook of the Philosophy of Political Science, edited by Harold Kincaid, and Jeroen Van Bouwel. Oxford: Oxford University Press.
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah; Samuli Reijula; Petri Ylikoski (2020) Argumentative Landscapes: the functions of models in social epistemology, Synthese, https://doi.org/10.1007/s11229-020-02661-9 (🔓 Open Access)
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah and Emin Köksal (2019) "Explanatory Value in Context: The Curious Case of Hotelling's Location Model", The European Journal of the History of Economic Thought, 26 (5): 879-910 https://doi.org/10.1080/09672567.2019.1626460
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah and P. Ylikoski (2018) "Three conceptions of a theory of institutions",  Philosophy of the Social Sciences, 48(6), 550–568. DOI: 10.1177/0048393118798619
    Ungated version available at TUHAT 
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2018) "The Diversity of Models as a Means to Better Explanations in Economics", Journal of Economic Methodology, 25(3), 237-251. DOI: 10.1080/1350178X.2018.1488478
    Pre-print available at SSRN & ResearchGate.
  • Aydınonat, N. Emrah (2018) "Philosophy of Economics Rules: introduction to the symposium, Journal of Economic Methodology, 25(3), 211-217. https://doi.org/10.1080/1350178X.2018.1503143
    Pre-print available at: ResearchGate
  • Aydınonat, N. Emrah & Petri Ylikoski (2014) “Understanding with Theoretical Models“, Journal of Economic Methodology, 21 (1): 19-36. http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/1350178X.2014.886470
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2012) “‘People are not usually stupid’ but is this enough for economics?”, History of Economic Ideas, XX (3): 153-63 (A review essay on Maurice Lagueux’s Rationality and Explanation in Economics)  https://www.jstor.org/stable/23723686
    Available @ResearchGate
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2012) “The two images of economics: Why the fun disappears when difficult questions are at stake?“, Journal of Economic Methodology,19 (3): 243–58. https://doi.org/10.1080/1350178X.2012.714142
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2011) "The Origin of Money: Interdisciplinary Perspectives", in  Ganßmann, H. (ed.) New Approaches to Monetary Economics and Theory: Interdisciplinary Perspectives (Routledge International Studies in Money and Banking), London: Routledge, forthcoming.
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2010) Neuroeconomics: More than inspiration, less than revolution, Journal of Economic Methodology, 17 (2): 159 - 169. https://doi.org/10.1080/13501781003756444
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2007) Models, conjectures and exploration: an analysis of Schelling's checkerboard model of residential segregation, Journal of Economic Methodology, Volume 14 Issue 4, pp. 429 - 454. https://doi.org/10.1080/13501780701718680
  • Aydınonat, N. E., (2005) "An interview with Thomas C. Schelling: Interpretation of game theory and the checkerboard model." Economics Bulletin, 2 (2): pp. 1-7
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Is the Invisible Hand un-Smithian? A Comment on Rothschild," Economics Bulletin, 2 (1): pp. 1-8.
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2006) "Game Theoretic Models as a Framework for Analysis" in Aktan, C. C. (ed.) Advances in Economics: Theory and Applications, Vol 2, İzmir: Anıl Matbaacılık.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Institutions: Theory, History and Context-Specific Analysis" History of Economic Ideas 3 (A Review essay on Avner Greif, Institutions and the Path to the Modern Economy: Lessons from Medieval Trade, Cambridge, Cambridge University Pres, 2006, xx + 503.) https://www.jstor.org/stable/23722866
    Available @ResearchGate

Contribution(s) to Report(s)

  • Aydinonat, N. E., together with ILO Office for Turkey & TEPAV (incl. Brakenhielm, C., Baycık, G., Aşık, G., Özdoğan, İ., Kaymaz, T., Başıhoş, S.) (2016). Contractual arrangements in Turkey’s coal mines: forms, extents, drivers, legal drivers and impact on OSH. Ankara: ILO. http://www.ilo.org/public/libdoc/ilo/2016/490650.pdf.

Book Reviews:

  • Aydinonat (2011) "Review of The Oxford Handbook of Philosophy of Economics,  Harold Kincaid and Don Ross", Economics and Philosophy, November 2011 27, pp 317-324, DOI: 10.1017/S026626711100023X Online: http://journals.cambridge.org/abstract_S026626711100023X
  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2010) "Is spontaneous order a value-free descriptive methodological tool?" (Review of Adam Smith’s Political Philosophy: The Invisible Hand and Spontaneous Order, by Craig Smith, London, Routledge, 2006) Journal of Economic Methodology, Vol. 17, No. 4, December 2010, 449–453

Articles (in Turkish)

  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2013) "Topal Kapitalizm", Birikim 286, Şubat 2013, sf. 52-53 [PDF]
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2011) “’Sağdan git hep sağdan, kaldırımın sağından!’ Evrimsel Oyun Teorisi ve Koordinasyon Konvansiyonları”, içinde: Kaymak M. ve A. Şahinöz (der.) (2011) Darwin ve Evrimsel İktisat, Ankara: Hacettepe Üniversitesi Yayınları, sf. 41-66 [PDF]
  • Aydinonat, N. Emrah (2010) "Adam Smith’in ‘Görünmez El’i: Doğru sanıyor olabileceğiniz yanlışlar" in M. Kara & N.E. Aydınonat (eds) Görünmez Adam Smith, İletişim Yayınları. (in Turkish, Adam Smith's Invisible Hand)

Ph.D. Thesis

  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2004) Explaining Unintended Consequences of Human Action: An Inquiry into the Role of Conjectures in Social Science, PhD. Thesis, Ankara: Imaj Yayınevi.

Master Thesis

  • Aydinonat, N. E. (1998) Heckscher-Ohlin Teoreminin İktisadi Analiz Tarihindeki Kuramsal Temelleri, (Theoretical Roots of the Heckscher-Ohlin Theorem), Master Thesis, Ankara: Ankara University, Institute of Social Sciences.

Essays for the Economic Policy Research Foundation of Turkey (in Turkish)

  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2013) "İstanbul Son Ağaç Havalimanı - İstanbul’un 3. havalimanı hakkında bilmeniz gerekenler!", Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu, N201324 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2013) "Yahu Biz Bu İşi Niye Yapıyorduk? Korsanla Mücadele ve Devletin İstanbul Taksi Piyasası ile İmtihanı", Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu, N201320 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2012) "Finansal Eylem Görev Timi Türkiye'den Ne İstiyor", Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu N201274 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2012) "'Böbrek piyasası', Nobel ve iktisadi büyüme politikaları", Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu N201270 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2012) "2023 te 25 Bin Dolar Gelir Hayal Degil Ama...", Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu N201245 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2012) “Engelli İstihdamını Arttırmanın Yolları”, Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu N201232 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2012) “İş Sağlığı ve Güvenliği Kanunu Tasarısı - İş Kazalarıyla ilgili Değerlendirme ve Öneriler”, Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu, N201229 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2012) “Teknolojik İlerleme ve Devletin Rolü - İsrail, Tayvan ve İrlanda örneklerinden Türkiye için dersler”, Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu, N201228 (PDF)
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2012) “Gelişmiş Ülkelerde Kademeli Eğitim Var mı?”, Türkiye Ekonomi Politikaları Araştırma Vakfı (TEPAV) Değerlendirme Notu N201213 (PDF)

Selected Opinion Pieces and other stuff (in Turkish)

Opinion pieces for Business HT, Wall Street Journal Turkey, Economic Policy Research Foundation of Turkey (TEPAV | Think-Tank) and Açık Ekonomi (Blog)

  • Şart midur? (Business HT, 30.8.2015)
  • Tek Derste Türkiye Ekonomisi (Business HT, 25.8.2015)
  • Vestel neden koruma istiyor? (Business HT, 19.7.2015)
  • 6 adımda piyasa yorumcusu olma rehberi (Business HT, 22.6.2015)
  • CHP ve HDP kaynağı nereden bulacak? (Business HT, 22.4.2015)
  • Siyasal Partiler için Ekonomi Paketi Hazırlama Rehberi (Business HT, 8.4.2015)
  • Kart Borçlarından Kurtulmanın Yolları (Business HT, 1.4.2015)
  • Cüzdandaki Canavar: Kredi Kartı (Business HT, 24.3.2015)
  • Faiz tartışmasına takılıp kalmak (Business HT, 7.3.2015)
  • Faizi indirelim, ekonomiyi canlandıralım (Açık Ekonomi, 24.2.2015 | Business HT 4.3.2015)
  • Phileas’ı hatırlayanınız var mı? (TEPAV, 31.12.2014)
  • Ölümcül siyasal bağlantılar ve iş kazaları(Wall Street Journal Turkey)
  • Nobel Ekonomi Ödülü’nden alınacak 7 ders(Wall Street Journal Turkey)
  • Demokrasiden kaçarken orta gelir tuzağına takılmak!(Wall Street Journal Turkey)

  • 10 Soruda GSYH İle İlgili Bilmek İstedikleriniz(Wall Street Journal Turkey)

  • Piketty Deliliğine Katkı (1)(TEPAV)
  • Seçimler ve Toplumdaki Güven Kaybı(TEPAV)
  • Twitter Yasakken Ekonomi Konuşulur mu?(TEPAV)

  • MIT Kaydı, Frekans Hoplaması ve Malum Odaklar(TEPAV)
  • Yaratıcılıkta Yeni Dönem(TEPAV)

Some other stuff

  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2017) "İktisadı Adabıyla Öğrenmek", İktisat ve Toplum, 79: 50-52
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2013) "İktisat Politikası, Emniyet Kemeri ve Biber Gazı" İktisat ve Toplum, 37: 23-26
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2008) "Korkut Boratav ile Ekonomik Kriz Üzerine (Söyleşi)" (On the Economic Crisis: Interview with Korkut Boratav) Mülkiye Dergisi, 260 (Güz)
  • Aydinonat, N.E. (2008) "Kalkınma ve Çokeşlilik" (Development and Polygamy: Perspective from Economics),  Mülkiyeliler Birliği E-Bülten, Aralık (No. 8)
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (2007) İktisat Öğrencileri için Ödev Yazma Kılavuzu, Ankara Üniversitesi, Siyasal Bilgiler Fakültesi, Online: http://80.251.40.59/politics.ankara.edu.tr/aydinona/rehber/Aydinonat_2006_Odev_Rehberi.pdf
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2007) "İktisat Üzerine Söyleşiler II" (Dialogues on Philosophy of Economics II), Mülkiye Felsefe Topluluğu Felsefe Bülteni 3.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Savaşı Kim Kazandı? Hizbullah mı? İsrail mi? Yoksa ABD mi?" (Who did win the War? Hizbullah, İsrael, or USA?), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 252-10
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Kurtlar Vadisi Türkiye: Hoşgörüsüzlük, Tahamülsüzlük ve Yalanla Yaşayanlar" (Intolerance and Private Lies), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 251-9
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Thomas C. Schelling", Mülkiye Felsefe Topluluğu Felsefe Bülteni 2.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2006) "Bonobo Çözümü" (Bonobo Solution), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 250-8.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2005) "Her Şeyde Şifre Aramak: Piri Reis Haritasının Şifresi" (Searching for Codes Everywhere: The Code of the Piri Reis Map), Radikal Kitap 16.09.2005 (uzun versiyon)
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2005) "Öküzün Boynuzlarındaki Dünya" (The Flat World), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 249-7.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2004) "Portakal Suyu ve Madde 22" (Orange Juice and Catch-22), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 245-3.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2004) "Bezelye, Brno Kenti ve Sibel Kekilli" (Peas, Brno and Sibel Kekili), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 244-2.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2004) "42 Kitap, Müzik, Hayat..." (42: Books, Music, Life...), Mülkiyeliler Birliği Dergisi 243-1.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (2004) "İktisat Üzerine Söyleşiler I: İlyas ve Filizsu arasındaki Konuşma" (Dialogues on Philosophy of Economics I: Dialogue between İlyas and Filizsu), Mülkiye Felsefe Topluluğu Felsefe Bülteni 1.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (1995) "İktisatta Metodoloji Tartışmaları" (Methodology Discussions in Economics) İktisatça 1 (1): pp. 87-94.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (1999) "Function Ascriptions and Functional Explanation", Discussion Papers no: 20, Ankara University Faculty of Political Sciences.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (1999) "Invisible Hand Explanations: The Case of Menger's Explanation of the Origin of Money", Discussion Papers no: 21, Ankara University Faculty of Political Sciences.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (1997) "Finans Piyasalarında Bilgi Aksaklıkları ve Hayek'te Bilgi Problemi" (Informational Imperfections in Financial Markets and Knowledge Problem in Hayek), Discussion Papers no: 6, Ankara University Faculty of Political Sciences.
  • Aydinonat, N. E. (1997) "Etnik Cazda Bir Izlenimci: Egberto Gismonti" (An Impressionist in ethnic Jazz: Egberto Gismonti), Roll Dergisi No:12, October 1997, pp. 45-46.
  • Aydinonat, N. E., (1994) Hayatın Başlangıcı ve İnsanın Ataları Üzerine Bir Özet (A Summary of the Beginnings of Life and the Evolution of Man), Ankara University, Dep. of Economics, Ankara.

entry.title: CV
entry.summary: Education Degrees awarded Ph.D. September 2004. Erasmus Institute for Philosophy and Economics (EIPE), Erasmus School of Philosophy, Erasmus University Rotterdam,…
entry.content:
Education

Degrees awarded

  • Ph.D. September 2004. Erasmus Institute for Philosophy and Economics (EIPE),  Erasmus School of Philosophy, Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL.
  • M.Phil. Philosophy and Economics. August 1999. EIPE, Erasmus School of Philosophy, Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL.
  • MA. Economics. July 1998. Faculty of Political Science, Ankara University, TR.
  • B.Sc. Economics. July 1995. Faculty of Political Science, Ankara University, TR.

Title of docent

  • Docent (Practical Philosophy). December 2019. University of Helsinki.
  • Docent (Economic Thought). March 2012. Higher Education Council of Turkey, TR.

Employment

Current position

  • Researcher. Practical Philosophy, Faculty of Social Sciences, University of Helsinki. 02.2016—present.

Past positions

  • Associate Professor. Bahçeşehir University, Faculty of Economics, Administrative & Social Sciences, İstanbul, Turkey, 09.2012—02.2016
  • Assistant Professor, International Economics and Economic Growth Chair, Department of Economics, Faculty of Social Sciences, Ankara University, Ankara, Turkey, 03.2008 – 09.2012.
  • Researcher, TINT, Department of Social and Moral Philosophy Group, University of Helsinki, FI, 09.2008 - 09.2009.
  • Lecturer, Department of Economics, Faculty of Social Sciences, Ankara University, TR, 02.2005 – 03.2008.
  • Research and Teaching Assistant, Department of Economics, Faculty of Social Sciences, Ankara University, TR, 08.1996 – 02-2005.

Visiting and Adjunct Positions

  • Visiting lecturer. Faculty of Philosohy. Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL. May-June 2019.
  • Visiting lecturer. Faculty of Philosohy. Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL. May-June 2018
  • Adjunct Associate Professor. Boğaziçi University, İstanbul, TR. 2012-201.
  • Adjunct Assistant Professor. Boğaziçi University, Dept. of Economics, 09.2009 –02.2012.
  • Adjunct Assistant Professor. Galatasaray University, Dept. of Economics, 09.2010 – 09. 2012.
  • Adjunct Assistant Professor. Yıldız Technical University, Dept. of Economics, 09.2011 – 09. 2012.

Research associate

  • Research Associate, Trend and Tensions in Intellectual Integration [TINT], University of Helsinki, FI | 09.2009 – 02.2016.
  • Research Associate, Economic Policy Research Foundation of Turkey. TEPAV | Think-Tank, Ankara, TR, 01.2012—07.2017

Teaching

  • Highly experienced. Taught economics and philosophy courses to diverse sets of undergraduate and graduate students at several institutions including University of Helsinki (FI), Erasmus University Rotterdam (NL), Tallinn Technology University, Estonian Business School (EST), Ankara University (TR), Boğaziçi University (TR), Galatasaray University (TR).
  • Completed courses. University Pedagogy 1. Learning in Higher Education, spring 2019. University of Helsinki.

Service

Editorships

  • Chief editor, Journal of Economic Methodology, starting from 01.2020 (w/ Jack Vromen).
  • Associate editor, Journal of Economic Methodology, 09.2016—01.2020.
  • Member of the Editorial Board, History of Economic Ideas, 12.2014—present.

Guest Editor / Special Issues

  • Guest Editor. Synthese Special Issue on Unrealistic Models (w/ Uskali Mäki & Till Grüne-Yanoff) 01-2019—present.
  • Guest Editor. Journal of Economic Methodology Special Issue: Dani Rodrik’s Economics Rules (2018 Vol. 25, 3).
  • Guest editor (w/Jack Vromen). Journal of Economic Methodology Special Issue: Economics Made Fun (2012, Vol. 19, 3)

Workshop – Conference Organization

  • Member of the local organizing committee. International Network for Economic Methodology (INEM) Conference. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 19-21 August 2019. ~100 participants.
  • Co-organizer (w/ U. Maki & C. Lisciandra) Multiple Models Workshop. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 2-3 October 2018. 10 speakers, ~25 participants.
  • Co-organizer (w/ U. Maki and T. Grüne-Yanoff) Workshop: What to make of highly unrealistic models. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 12-13 October 2017. 15 Talks, one poster session, ~30 participants.
  • Co-organizer (w/J. Vromen) Symposium: Economics Made Fun in the face of the economic crisis. Erasmus University Rotterdam, NL. 10-11 December 2010. 12 speakers, ~30 participants.
  • Member of the organizing committee of the TINT Market and Marketization Workshop. University of Helsinki, Helsinki, FI. 2010-2014.
  • Organizer of the economics education program Economics for Everyone, Bahçeşehir University, Turkey—aims at providing economics education to the public, 05.2012 – 02.2016.
  • Member of the local organizing committee. European Society for the History of Economic Thought (ESHET) Conference: Competition, Innovation and Rivalry, Boğaziçi University, Istanbul, TR. 19-22 May 2011. ~150 participants
  • Member of the Scientific Committee of EAEPE 2009 Conference in Amsterdam, 2009.
  • Member of the Program Committee of International Conference of Political Economy: Adam Smith Today, 2009.

Research coordination

  • Economic Methodology Research area coordinator, together with Professor Uskali Mäki, European Association for Evolutionary Political Economy (EAEPE), 2008-present.

Refereeing

  • Erkenntnis, Synthese, European Journal for Philosophy of Science, Journal of Social Ontology, Journal of Institutional Economics, History of Economic Ideas, Journal of Artificial Societies And Social Simulation, Journal of Economic Methodology, Routledge Books.
  • ERC External evaluator. Philosophy. ERC Starter Grants 2018, European Research Council.

Expert duties, assignments and research-based policy-advice

  • Advisor and contributor to the ILO/TEPAV report on Contractual arrangements in Turkey’s coal mines (2016, International Labour Organization, ILO Office for Turkey. - Ankara: ILO).
  • Prepared Policy Notes for Economic Policy Research Foundation of Turkey, TEPAV | Think-Tank, Ankara, TR, 01.2012—07.2017

Other

Research dissemination and communication

  • Blog Editor, Centre for Philosophy of Social Science, University of Helsinki, 2019.
  • Author of the popular science book: İktisat Nedir?, İletişim Yayınları, (in Turkish, What is Economics?) – 2014.
  • Editor of the popular science book: Hayatın İçindeki İktisat, İletişim Yaynları, (in Turkish, Economics in Everyday Life) – 2019
  • Columnist/Writer, Business HT (03.2015 –08.2016). Wall Street Journal Turkey (05.2014 – 12.2014). TEPAV Blog (02.2012—12.2014)
  • Blog Editor & Co-Founder, Açık Ekonomi (Economics Blog, in Turkish), 2012—2017.
  • Organizer of Economics for Everyone, Bahçeşehir University, TR—aims at providing economics education to the public, 05.2012 – 02.2016.

Administrative responsibilities

  • Coordinator of actvities, Centre for Philosophy of Social Science (TINT), September 2019 – present.
  • Vice Dean, Bahçeşehir University, Faculty of Economics, Administrative & Social Sciences, İstanbul, TR, 10.2015 – 05.2016.

Memberships

  • Elected Member of the Executive Committee, International Network for Economic Methodology (INEM), 08.2017—present.
  • Methodology of Economics Research Area Coordinator, (w/Uskali Mäki). European Association for Evolutionary Political Economy. 2008—present.
  • Council Member, European Association for Evolutionary Political Economy, January 2008 – January 2010.

Invited keynote lectures (selected)

  • 19.09.2019. Invited Speaker. “Multiple model idealization in economics” Colloque de lancement du Réseau International de Recherche « Justice et intérêt » / « Justice and Interest » International Research Network Kick Off Meeting - 19-20 Septempber 2019, Marseilles, France.
  • 27.04.2017. Invited Speaker. "Diversity of models as a means to truer explanations in economics", Higher Seminar in Economics, University of Södertörn, SWE.
  • 9-10.05.2016. Invited Speaker, “The Invisible Hand in Economics”, The Invisible Hand in Law, Economy and Culture. Workshop on Spontaneous Order, Mechanisms and Unintended Consequences, Warsaw, PL.
  • 25.05.2015. Invited Speaker at the World Bank Development Report 2015 Launch Event in Ankara, TR.
  • 21-23.10.2013. Invited Lecture on history and methodology of economics, Universität Bayreuth, Bayreuth, DE.
  • 2.09.2013. Invited Lecture. “Institutions, history and context-specific analysis”, History of Economic Thought, Economic Philosophy and Economic History 16th Summer School, Middle East Technical University, Ankara, TR.
  • 15-18.06.2006. Invited Speaker. “Micromotives and Macrobehavior”, Plenary Session, 2nd International Conference on Business Management and Economics, İzmir, TR

entry.title: Teaching
entry.summary: 2021-22 Fall - Philosophy of Economics (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (Online via Zoom) Spring - Paradigms in…
entry.content:
2021-22

  • Fall - Philosophy of Economics (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (Online via Zoom)
  • Spring - Paradigms in Social Science (PhD course), Estonian Business School, Tallinn, Estonia (Online via Zoom)

2020-21

  • Fall - Philosophy of Economics (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (Online via Zoom)
  • Fall -Development Economics (Bachelor’s and Master’s) - TalTech, Tallinn, Estonia (3h Guest Lecture, Online via Zoom)
  • Spring - Paradigms in Social Science (PhD course), Estonian Business School, Tallinn, Estonia (Online via Zoom)

2019-20

  • Fall - Understanding Economic Models (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (UEM Syllabus_2019-20 draft)
  • Spring - Paradigms in Social Science (PhD course), Estonian Business School, Tallinn, Estonia

2018-19

  • Summer - Philosophy of Economics (FEB12002X) - Erasmus University Rotterdam
  • Fall - Understanding Economic Models (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki
  • Spring - Paradigms in Social Science (PhD course), Estonian Business School, Tallinn, Estonia

 

2017 - 2018

  • Summer - Philosophy of Economics (FEB12002X) - Erasmus University Rotterdam
  • Summer - A short course in Behavioral Economics (w/ E.Agner & M. Nagatsu), Summer School in Behavioral Economics, 17–22 June 2018 Tallinn, Estonia
  • Fall - Understanding Economic Models (w/ M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (Syllabus)

2016 - 2017

  • Understanding Economic Models (w/M. Nagatsu) - University of Helsinki (Syllabus)
  • Economic Thought & Methodology (PhD. course, w/ M. Nagatsu & A. Hazak) - Tallinn University of Technology

2009 - 2016

  • Introduction to Microeconomics - Bahçeşehir University (2013 - 2016)
  • Introduction to Macroeconomics - Bahçeşehir University (2013 - 2016)
  • Comparative Economic History - Bahçeşehir University (2012 - 2016)
  • Managerial Economics (MBA) - Bahçeşehir University (2013 - 2016)
  • Institutional Economics - Boğaziçi University (2009 – 2016)
  • Comparative Schools of Thought - Boğaziçi University (2009 – 2016)
  • Political Economy of Capitalism - Bahçeşehir University (2012 – 2016)
  • Economic Policies & Strategies (Graduate Level) - Bahçeşehir University (2012-2014)
  • Microeconomics (Intermediate) - Bahçeşehir University (2012-2013)
  • International Trade Theory (Graduate Level) - Yıldız Technical University (2011-2012)
  • Institutional Economics (Graduate Level) - Galatasaray University (2011-2012)
  • Microeconomics (Graduate Level) - Galatasaray University (2010-2011)
  • Models & Methodology in Economics (in Turkish) - Ankara University (2005-08 & 2010-12)
  • Economic Growth (in Turkish) - Ankara University (2005-08 & 2010-12)
  • International Economics (Theory) (in Turkish) - Ankara University (2009-2010)
  • International Economics (Policy) (in Turkish) - Ankara University (2009-2010)

Supervised Theses

  • Pluralism in Economics and the State of Pluralism in Turkish Economics Education – Gökhan Övenç (Galatasaray University, 2013)
